page.title: 07CHANGES IN WREXHAM
page.content: Mrs. Kitty Davies of Bryn Offa has lived in Wrexham for over 60 years. She remembers it as a much smaller town when horses were used to pull milk carts. She remembers V.E. day especially, when a street party was held in Bradley Road. She thinks some aspects of the town have improved but she prefered it as it was when it was smaller. Mrs. Jane Davies of 124 Bryn Offa has lived in the town for 72 years. She remembers when the town boasted 4 cinemas- the Glynn, Majestic, Hippodrome, Odeon. She thinks the town has changed for the worse. She misses the little shops and doesn't like the supermarkets. She thinks that the people have changed too! Mr. David Williams has lived in the town for 80 yrs and remembers trams travelling along the streets.
